attributes.action: Suspend the Fixed-term parliament act and call a general election.
attributes.background:
The current Government has not been elected on a manifesto including what the UK electorate wants from EU exit negotiations. 

It is only right, proper and democratic that the electorate be given the opportunity to elect a new Government and give it a mandate for those negotiations.

I

rejection.details:
Parliament may amend or repeal the Fixed-term Parliaments Act 2011.

You may wish to submit a petition calling for it to take either of these actions.
